results.title: Aristotle and the scientific method
results.brief_description: An analysis of Aristotle’s contribution to the development of scientific method. Departing from Plato’s ideas, Aristotle made observations based on his experience, classified his data, performed experiments and sought to arrive at generalizations or principles. Also examines how his work laid the foundation for such sciences as botany and zoology. No other credits available.

results.title: Ariel. Hamlet goes business
results.brief_description: Two feature films from Finnish filmmaker Aki Kaurismaki. “Ariel”: Propelled by the closure of the local mine and faced with unemployment Taisto Kasurinen (Turo Pajala) sets off in his Cadillac across the bleak and wintery Finnish landscape into the depressed industrial towns. In search of work and love he meets Irmeli (Susanna Haavisto) and together they express their desire for love with emotional efficiency. The soundtrack of popular 50s and 60s romance tunes expresses the love that our protagonists are incapable of expressing. Signalling hope, Kaurismaki finds humanity in the most bleak of places and with characters whose lives are filled with much hardship and hurt, managing to create a film that bubbles with affection. “Hamlet goes business”: This second black comedy reprises Shakespeare’s Hamlet into a contemporary setting where bitter family rivalry, revenge and greed are the order of the day. A brutish father is poisoned while plots are hatched to extract his millions. But this evil family has no plan and gradually the double-crossing characters fall victim to their own vices. A farcical take on the classic with Kaurismaki’s trademark deadpan humour. Combined cast includes: Turo Pajala, Susanna Haavisto, Matti Pellonpaa, Eetu Hilkamo, Pirkka-Pekka Petelius, Eskoski Salminen, Kati Outinen, Elina Salo, Esko Nikkari, Kari Vaananen, Turo Pajala, Matti Pei.

results.title: Ariel II
results.brief_description: Deals with the history of the second international satellite and how it was developed and placed into orbit by American and British scientists in an effort to gain new knowledge about the structure of the universe. It covers research, experiments and development in Britain and assembly, testing and launching in the U.S. Produced for N.A.S.A. No other credits available.

results.title: Ariel
results.brief_description: Surreal, dryly hilarious road movie from one of the most talented directors to emerge on the international film scene in the late 1980s. The scenario chronicles the plight of a mine worker who loses his job and sets out on a crosscountry odyssey but who is forced by circumstances into a life of crime. Winner of the International Critics Prize at the Moscow International Film Festival. In Finnish with English subtitles.

results.title: Arid zones of Peru
results.brief_description: The work of Arid Zones Research Institute in Peru. Research on the soil, underground water, climate and farming practice in the Ica valley. How areas of desert have been brought into production, chiefly for high quality cotton. Incidental impressions of the life of the people, with a background of Peruvian folk music. No other credits available. Produced for UNESCO.

results.title: Ariadne auf Naxos
results.brief_description: The Metropolitan Opera production of Richard Strauss’s “Ariadne auf Naxos” stars Jessye Norman tells of Ariadne who saved Prince Theseus of Athens from the perils of the Cretan labyrinth. She becomes his lover and joins him on his travels. Faithless Theseus deserts her on Naxos and she awaits death, inconsolable and heart-broken.

results.title: Arguing the Toss of a Cat
results.brief_description: This lighthearted comedy features Victor the cat who wanders around a block of flats in a Melbourne dockside suburb. Rose and William are a young couple sharing the upstairs flat. Rose is a jazz singer auditioning for an overseas tour with a famous jazz band. William draws pictures for children’s storybooks. Rose wants William to go with her but William wants to stay put. They draw comfort from Victor and use him as a sounding board for their own side of what turns into an argument. However, the other two tenants want Victor to share their problems too.

results.title: Argentina
results.brief_description: Buenos Aires is the commercial, industrial, and financial centre of Argentina; the inland pampas region is the source of Argentina’s wealth. The interdependence of the city and the agricultural area is emphasised.
